content: by denise layman i whipped up this little beret for my blythe doll claire i thought i would share the pattern since it was so fast and fun enjoy hook k yarn small amount of heavy worsted weight yarn sample made with plymouth bella colour in color #16 it only took a very small amount to make the hat i will probably use the rest to make her a matching dress notions removable stitch marker tapestry needles abbreviations half_double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet make a slip knot and work 6 single_crochet into it pull the slip knot to tighten mark beginning of the round 1 work 2 half_double_crochet into each single_crochet 12 stitches 2 * work 1 half_double_crochet then increase 1* repeat to end of row 3 *work 2 half_double_crochet then increase 1* repeat to end of row 4 *work 3 half_double_crochet then increase 1 * repeat to end of row 5 *work 4 half_double_crochet then increase 1* repeat to end of row 6 *work 5 half_double_crochet then increase 1* repeat to end of row 7 work 2 rounds even in half_double_crochet 8 *work 5 single_crochet then decrease by 1* repeat to end of row 9 *work 3 single_crochet then decrease by 1* repeat to end of row 10 *work 2 single_crochet then decrease by 1* repeat to end of row 11 work 1-2 row in single_crochet as desired for depth finish and weave in ends enjoy ©denise mae layman all rights reserved please note this pattern is copyrighted material you may print a copy of this pattern for your own use including making and using/selling hats made following this pattern so long as design credit is given and linked to www knitchat com editing publishing transmitting e-mailing posting this pattern in part or whole to a list service or database is strictly forbidden
